item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The Stallman Report (100 points | 96 comments)
2. Boring Tech Is Stifling Improvement (22 points | 34 comments)
3. OpenD on iPhone/Mac/etc.: ldc gets extern(Objective-C), dmd gets pragma(linkerDirective) and @section (14 points | 1 comment)
4. a protocol for reliable notifications over a 1 bit fallible connection (6 points | no comments)
5. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (27 points | 13 comments)
6. Moving to LLVM IR (8 points | no comments)
7. vortex: A toolkit for working with compressed Arrow in-memory, on-disk, and over-the-wire. "The LLVM of file formats" (13 points | no comments)
8. What are you doing this week? (19 points | 29 comments)
9. Trust Rules Everything Around Me (WordPress, Code Security, etc.) (21 points | no comments)
10. The `Overwrite` trait and `Pin` (8 points | 1 comment)
11. Antithesis: Pioneering Deterministic Hypervisors with FreeBSD and Bhyve (6 points | no comments)
12. Minetest Rebranding to Luanti (17 points | 3 comments)
13. Ward Christensen, BBS inventor and architect of our online age, dies at age 78 (6 points | 1 comment)
14. Arduino to switch from Arm Mbed to Zephyr RTOS (3 points | 1 comment)
15. The Tragedy of the Common Lisp: Why Large Languages Explode (2015) (15 points | 4 comments)
16. FFmpeg Explorer (2023) (14 points | 1 comment)
17. Text-overflow: Ellipsis Considered Harmful (2022) (8 points | 2 comments)
18. Ubuntu Will Include The Latest Linux Kernel Version in Future Releases (18 points | 33 comments)
19. fjall: LSM-based embeddable key-value storage engine written in safe Rust (7 points | 1 comment)
20. Use an External GPU on Raspberry Pi 5 for 4K Gaming (3 points | no comments)
21. Deriving the Kelly Criterion to maximise Profits (7 points | no comments)
22. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (25 points | 7 comments)
23. Python client for the $20 Colmi R02 smart ring (20 points | 3 comments)
24. You Could Have Invented Normalization-by-Evaluation (7 points | no comments)
25. How to fork: Best practices and guide (2 points | no comments)
